course.subject: MARK
course.name: Smart Business Experiments and Causal Inference
course.description: This course aims to teach students basic conceptions and methods for conducting causal estimations in business problems. The course will cover classical causal inference framework, and different methodologies that could be used in various settings, including randomized, quasi-, and natural experiments, and observation data.

reviews.author: sn04
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction
2. Potential Outcomes Framework
3. Classical Randomized Experiments
4. Classical Randomized Experiments II
5. Matching and Weighting Method
6. Regression-based Method I
7. Regression-based Method II

Useful for research projects in later courses, and is a big trend in marketing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Liu is Great and makes herself very clear and willing to answer the questions and the assignments.
Quite practical and hardcore knowledge
Provide hands-on experience and tutorials for assignments
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Individual Assignments (15% each)
1 Group Assignment (15%)
1 Final Exam (30%)
Class Participation (10%)
reviews.comment_workload:
It is a 2-credit MARK elective course
The workload is high and requires amount of time for assignments.
